summary:
Trading Halt Request
- Reason: Pending announcement of a capital raising (placement).
- Duration: Until market open on 11 August 2025 or earlier if announcement is released.

No further material information identified.

• Director's Interest Change:
  • Director: Thomas McKeith
  • Indirect interests via entities (McKeith Super Pty Ltd, McKeith Family A/C, GenGold Resource Capital Pty Ltd).
  • Key change: Expiry of 375,000 unlisted options at $0.12 on 5 August 2025. No other changes to holdings.

  • Total holdings post-change:

    • Ordinary shares: 16,634,329 (family trust) + 1,167,252 (super fund) + 6,558,333 (GenGold).
    • Remaining options/rights: Details retained as per notice.

  • No closed period trading.

No material trading or capital markets impact identified (routine disclosure of expired options).

No material information identified.

(This is a standard certification of interim financial filings with no explicit operational, financial, or governance updates relevant to trading or capital markets decisions.)

No material information identified.
(This is a routine certification of interim financial filings with no disclosures impacting valuation, liquidity, or capital structure.)

Capital Raising Announcement & Strategic Advisor Appointment
- Capital Raising: Completed institutional placement (amount not disclosed), oversubscribed.
- Strategic Advisor: Appointed Tribeca Capital to enhance U.S. critical minerals strategy, focusing on:
- Downstream partnerships, government funding, and technology collaborations.
- Access to global investor networks and U.S. policy-aligned initiatives (e.g., antimony/REE supply chains).
- Next Key Catalysts:
- BLM approvals (expected September 2025) for expanded drilling at Mojave Project.
- Maiden drill results (Q4 2025) targeting high-grade antimony and REEs.
- JORC Exploration Target definition and metallurgical testwork initiation.

Strategic Position:
- Mojave Project adjacent to MP Materials’ assets, leveraging U.S. critical minerals incentives.
- Institutional investor base expanded post-placement.

Note: Total capital raised not explicitly stated; focus on strategic implications.

Exploration Update Announcement Summary:

  • High-grade rock chip results reported at Broken Hills Project (Nevada):
  • 2,469 g/t Ag, 5.36 g/t Au (sample ID: 340766)
  • 1,484 g/t Ag, 6.67 g/t Au (sample ID: 587119)
  • High-grade gold rock chip results at Caisson Project (Nevada):
  • 71.85 g/t Au, 41.06 g/t Au, 36.01 g/t Au
  • Exploration underway to define drill targets; both projects located in Walker Lane Trend (Nevada), a prolific gold-silver-copper region.
  • Projects acquired for USD 150,000 (100% ownership, 2% NSR retained by vendor).
  • No prior drilling at Caisson; limited historic drilling at Broken Hills.

No material financial/capital markets impact noted (exploration update only).

Summary of ASX Announcement - Presentation to 2025 Australian Rice Conference

  • Strategic Targets: Aspirational goal to achieve $3B revenue by 2030, focusing on margin expansion and global growth (Middle East, US, ANZ markets).
  • Australian Rice Strategy:
  • Targets 10ML/HA water efficiency, 15T/HA yield, and $500/tonne paddy price (subject to FX/quality).
  • Ends rice vesting; introduces flexible contracting and earlier pricing indications for growers.
  • FY25 Paddy Price: $380–$450/tonne range (unchanged), with $500/tonne as a future aspirational target.
  • Capital Structure Reminder: Dual-class shares (B Class Shares trade on ASX, no voting rights; A Class held by growers with control over board elections).

No material trading or capital-raising information identified.

Condensed Financial Summary - NexGen Energy Ltd. (Interim Financial Statements for 6 months ended June 30, 2025)

Key Financial Metrics

  • Cash Balance (June 30, 2025): CAD $371.6M (vs. CAD $476.6M at Dec 31, 2024).
  • Net Loss (6M 2025): CAD $137.6M (vs. CAD $21.4M loss in 6M 2024).
  • Includes impairment loss on associate (IsoEnergy): CAD $81.0M.
  • Mark-to-market loss on convertible debentures: CAD $32.7M (partially offset by gain of CAD $15.3M).
  • Convertible Debentures Outstanding: CAD $488.5M (US$360M principal).
  • Fair value gain driven by share price rise (CAD/USD exchange impact).
  • Exploration & Evaluation Assets: CAD $648.1M (+CAD $63.3M in 6M 2025).

Capital Markets & Liquidity

  • Working Capital Deficit: CAD $126.9M (including debentures), but CAD $371.6M cash covers non-debenture obligations for 15+ months.
  • Debenture Details:
  • 2023 Debentures: US$110M, 9% interest (6% cash, 3% shares).
  • 2024 Debentures: US$250M, 9% interest (terms same as above).
  • ASX CDI Offering (2024): Raised CAD $216.3M (gross) via 20.2M shares.

Operational Highlights

  • Strategic Uranium Inventory: 2.7M lbs U3O8 valued at CAD $341.2M (no impairment).
  • IsoEnergy Investment: 30.9% stake (fair value: CAD $158.5M), now accounted for as an associate.

Key Risks Disclosed

  • Liquidity Risk: Convertible debentures (CAD $488.5M) classified as current but no cash settlement due within 12 months.
  • Foreign Exchange Exposure: 10% CAD/USD shift impacts earnings by CAD $46.2M.

Conclusion

Material points: Large net loss (driven by impairments and debenture MTM), liquidity sufficient for 15+ months, ASX capital raising in 2024, and strategic uranium holdings. No new capital raising or material corporate actions announced.

Material Information Summary

1. Operational Highlights (Q2 2025)

  • Exploration Results:
  • Discovery of high-grade uranium at Patterson Corridor East (PCE):
    • RK-25-232: 15.0m at 15.9% U₃O₈, including 0.5m at 68.8% U₃O₈.
    • RK-25-227: 12.0m at 3.46% U₃O₈, including 2.5m at 14.9% U₃O₈.

  • Expanded high-grade zone to 210m strike length and 335m vertical extent.

  • Permitting:

  • Federal Approval Progress: CNSC public hearings scheduled for Nov 19, 2025, and Feb 9–13, 2026.
  • Provincial EA approval granted (Nov 2023); Final EIS accepted by CNSC (Jan 2025).

  • Site program approved by Saskatchewan Ministry of Environment (Jun 2025).

  • Strategic Acquisition:

  • Exercised ROFR to acquire Rio Tinto’s 10% carried interest in 39 mineral claims (Jul 2025).

2. Financial & Capital Markets Updates

  • Liquidity & Funding:
  • Cash: $371.6M CAD (vs. $476.6M at Dec 31, 2024).
  • Debentures: US$360M outstanding (2023 Debentures: US$110M; 2024 Debentures: US$250M).
  • ATM Program: Reduced to $141M CAD remaining capacity.

  • Working Capital: Deficit of $126.9M (adjusted surplus of $702.8M excluding debentures).

  • Key Risks:

  • Convertible Debentures: Mark-to-market loss of $55.7M in Q2 2025 (due to share price + FX fluctuations).

  • Foreign Exchange Exposure: 10% CAD/USD shift impacts earnings by $46.2M.

  • Investment in Associate (IsoEnergy):

  • 30.9% ownership (down from 32.8%); $81.0M impairment recorded in Q1 2025.

3. Project Economics (Rook I Feasibility Update)

  • Cost Adjustments:
  • CAPEX: Increased to $2.2B CAD (from $1.3B in 2021) due to inflation + engineering enhancements.
  • OPEX: $13.86/lb U₃O₈ (vs. $7.58/lb in 2021).
  • Sensitivity to Uranium Prices:
  • Base Case (US$50/lb): NPV $3.47B CAD, IRR 52.4%.
  • Upside (US$150/lb): NPV $12.80B CAD, IRR 101.8%.

Conclusion

  • Catalysts: Federal hearing outcomes (Q4 2025–Q1 2026), uranium price volatility, and project financing.
  • Key Risks: Liquidity constraints, regulatory delays, and execution risks in transitioning to production.

Note: Non-material operational/sustainability updates omitted.

Material Information Summary

Company Overview

  • ASX Code: BHM
  • Market Cap: A$121m (at $0.45/share)
  • Shares Issued: 269m
  • Options Issued: 89m (avg. strike $0.48/share)
  • Cash & Facilities: A$22m cash + A$40m conditional working capital (lead offtake facility pending).

Key Assets & Operations

  1. Rasp Mine (100% owned, operational)
  2. Mineral Resource: 10.1Mt @ 9.4% ZnEq (5.7% Zn, 3.2% Pb, 48.5g/t Ag).
  3. High-Grade Main Lode: 870kt @ 17.7% ZnEq (7.6% Pb, 7.8% Zn, 151.7g/t Ag).
  4. Infrastructure: 750ktpa processing plant, rail access, sunk capital in place.

  5. Near-Term Catalysts: Main Lode development (75% complete; target access Oct 2025).

  6. Pinnacles Mine (JV, 70% profit share)

  7. Mineral Resource: 6.0Mt @ 10.9% ZnEq (4.7% Zn, 3.3% Pb, 132g/t Ag).
  8. Exploration Target: 6–15Mt @ 2–4% Zn, 3–6% Pb, 40–125g/t Ag (conceptual).
  9. High-Grade Drilling Results: e.g., 5.9m @ 1,350g/t Ag, 17.4% Pb (52.8% ZnEq).

Strategic Highlights

  • Consolidation of Rasp (operations) + Pinnacles (resources) to optimize Broken Hill district potential.
  • Near-term production uplift: Main Lode development (Rasp) and Pinnacles open-pit studies (targeting 2026).
  • Offtake Financing:
  • Zinc offtake signed (US$11m facility).
  • Lead offtake term sheet (potential US$25m facility).

Key Risks

  • Resource Conversion: Exploration targets are conceptual; no reserves currently reported.
  • Operational Leverage: Rasp plant currently at ~50% capacity (tailings constraint).

No material capital raising, financial results, or market-sensitive timelines disclosed.

Valuation Drivers: Grade profile, Main Lode ramp-up, Pinnacles resource growth, and Zn/Pb/Ag price exposure.

• Tax-exempt bond capacity: Reservation of up to US$150 million in tax-exempt private activity bonds (PABs) from Virginia’s industrial development bond program.
  • Non-dilutive financing: Potential low-cost funding option for expansions beyond current Phase II titanium project (already backed by US$42.1M DoD funding).
  • No commitment yet: Due diligence on terms/pricing pending; no obligation to issue bonds.

No material trading or capital-raising actions announced; bond issuance remains contingent.

Material Information Summary

Exploration Update (Key Highlights)

  • Trekelano Prospect (Copper-Gold):
  • New off-hole EM conductor identified down-plunge of the main Inheritance orebody; drill testing to commence.

  • Assay Results (CBGT007):

    • 20m @ 1.3% CuEq (1.1% Cu, 0.2g/t Au)
    • 24m @ 1.1% CuEq (0.9% Cu, 0.2g/t Au)

  • Burke & Wills Prospect (Copper-Gold):

  • Shallow high-grade sulphide intersections:

    • 7m @ 3.9% CuEq (2.9% Cu, 1.2g/t Au) in BWRC101.

  • Lady Fanny Prospect (Copper-Gold):

  • 23.8m @ 0.5% CuEq (0.5% Cu, 0.1g/t Au) in geotechnical hole LFGT01.

  • Mount Hope Central (Copper-Gold):

  • 9m @ 2.0% CuEq (1.9% Cu, 0.1g/t Au) in MHRC291.

  • Devoncourt Project (Wimberu Prospect):

  • Drilling intersected broad zones of alteration with weak chalcopyrite-bornite mineralization; assays pending.

Corporate Metrics (as of 30 June 2025)

  • Market Cap: $86M (228.4M shares @ $0.375)
  • Cash Balance: $15.8M

Forward Catalysts

  • Pre-Feasibility Study (PFS) for Greater Duchess Project targeted for H2 CY2025.
  • Ongoing drilling at Trekelano and resource extension targets.

Format: Strictly concise, focusing on data impacting valuation, liquidity, or capital structure. Let me know if further refinement is needed.

• Contract with US Navy: MPW secures a $1M AUD contract to supply a mobile, containerized DirectPowder™ system to the U.S. Naval Postgraduate School.
  • Delivery timeline: System to be delivered within 12 weeks, completion expected by end of 2025.
  • Material impact: Demonstrates MPW's technology adoption in defense applications, potential for future contracts in expeditionary and defense sectors.

No capital raising, trading halt, or financial data disclosed.

Material Information Summary:

Type: Operational/Metallurgical Update

  • Key Highlights:
  • Successful production of battery-grade lithium hydroxide (LiOH) from Seymour spodumene concentrate, achieving 56.5% purity with low impurities.
  • High recovery rates: Average >94% lithium recovery via EcoPro’s conventional sulfation process.
  • Pilot plant success: 600kg of Seymour concentrate processed, validating flowsheet for Pre-Feasibility Study (PFS) and future offtake agreements.
  • Cost advantages: Lower calcination temperatures (due to high CaO content) and reagent consumption suggest reduced operational costs.
  • Next steps: Pilot testing for Root Lithium Project ore planned pending market conditions; PFS underway for Thunder Bay conversion facility.

Impact:

Confirms technical viability of GT1’s lithium conversion strategy, de-risking downstream integration and enhancing commercial appeal for future partnerships/capital raises.

Format: Concise bullet points focused on material trading/capital markets impact, excluding operational minutiae.

• Operational Efficiency Improvement: Plant production expected to ramp up to 85-90% of design capacity (from current 62-65%).
  • Production Increase: Monthly copper-gold concentrate output projected to rise to 3,000–3,200 DMT (from ~2,376 DMT).
  • Key Milestone: Successful commissioning of interim tailings filter presses (TFPs), reducing unplanned stoppages and improving throughput.

(No material capital markets or liquidity impacts identified; purely operational update.)

Material Information Summary:

  • Ore Sorting Results:
  • 132% upgrade achieved in antimony trisulfide (Sb₂S₃) content, yielding a 49.1% Sb₂S₃ product from ore with initial grade of 15.2% Sb (24.5% Sb₂S₃).
  • Single-pass recovery: 60.3% of antimony recovered in 26.1% of mass.

  • Gold synergy: 52.5% gold recovery in tailings, upgraded from 1.90 g/t Au to 2.99 g/t Au.

  • Strategic Significance:

  • Potential U.S. domestic antimony supply solution amid strained defense supply chains.

  • Estelle Project targets low-CAPEX, scalable processing with ore sorting for near-term production.

  • Next Steps:

  • Downstream flowsheet development underway (beneficiation/purification).
  • Stibium bulk sample ore sorting results pending.

No capital raising, timetable, or financial data disclosed.

FY26 Guidance Summary
- Production Guidance: 345,000 – 385,000 oz (including 15,000–30,000 oz from third-party ore).
- AISC Guidance: A$2,600 – A$2,900/oz.
- Non-Sustaining Capex: A$270M (focused on Bluebird-South Junction and Great Fingall mines).
- Exploration Budget: A$50M (split evenly between exploration and resource definition).
- FY25 Closing Cash: A$364M (cash, bullion, and investments).
- Key Operational Focus: Back-end weighted H2 production ramp-up at growth projects.

Material Projects:
- Bluebird-South Junction: Targeting steady-state run rate of 1–1.2Mtpa by FY26 end.
- Great Fingall: First ore from high-grade stopes in Q2 FY26; commercial production by FY27.
- Beta Hunt (Southern Goldfields): Infrastructure upgrades to support 2Mtpa mining rate.

Omitted: Forward-looking statements, compliance boilerplate, and non-quantitative commentary.

Summary of ASX Announcement - Exploration Update

  • Drill Campaign: 410-hole power auger program at 100%-owned Kandia Gold Prospect (Ghana).
  • Objective: Extend known mineralized zones (Kandia 4000/8000 prospects) and test new targets in Birimian terrane.
  • Targets: Focus on regional-scale structures linked to multi-million-ounce gold systems; anomalous results to trigger RC drilling follow-up.
  • Kpali Project: Auger sampling campaign planned post-interpretation of aeromagnetic data.
  • Context: Ghana’s under-explored northern region, analogous to prolific West African gold belts.

No material capital markets or trading-impacting details (e.g., financing, timelines, or resource estimates) identified.

Summary of Material Information:

  • Drilling Program: 35,300m grade control and infill drilling at Gold Duke Project (WA).
  • Timing: Program to commence mid-August, completed within 8 weeks. Assay updates every 7-8 days.
  • Key Benefits:
  • Eliminates need for grade control drilling during production.
  • Enhances mine scheduling flexibility.
  • Supports rapid path-to-production (mining operations targeted late Q4 2025).
  • Contractor: VM Drilling (local WA Goldfields-based, using fuel-efficient Epiroc rigs).
  • Upcoming Catalyst: Scoping Study update expected in coming weeks to improve project economics.

No material capital markets or trading-specific data (e.g., raising, halt, or financials) identified.

• Offtake Contract Expansion: New 5-year uranium offtake agreement with a major US utility for 1 million pounds/year, doubling total contracted volumes to 10 million pounds.

  • Uncontracted Reserves: 229.6M lbs of uranium reserves remain uncommitted for future sales optimization.
  • Strategic Impact: Strengthens NexGen’s position as a key future uranium supplier amid global energy security concerns.

Material Information Summary (ASX: BCA – Exploration Results Announcement)

  • Drill Results: High-grade manganese intersections confirmed at Wandanya, extending mineralization over ~2km strike. Key intercepts include:
  • 6m @ 35.0% Mn from surface (WDRC095)
  • 8m @ 28.5% Mn from surface (WDRC097)

  • 5m @ 29.3% Mn from surface (WDRC113)

  • Mineralization Scope: Open to north/east, with cross-strike widths of 150–450m. Average grade ~29% Mn.

  • Next Steps:

  • Phase 3 RC drilling (3,500m) to commence mid-August 2025, targeting 3km strike extension.

  • Assays for 47 pending drill holes (manganese/iron) expected by end-August 2025.

  • Metallurgical Potential: Prior tests achieved 45–50% Mn concentrate grades (exceeding premium 44% benchmark).

No capital raising, trading halt, or financial data disclosed.
